website_summaries.verdict: A top-notch under-sink water filter at a price that will fit easily into even the tightest budgets.
pros: Excellent quality for the price range
Just twist filters on and off to replace
Produces clean, odorless water without reducing water pressure
cons: Connects to 1/2" water hoses, but doesn't have equipment for 3/8" hose lines

customer_reviews.title: Installation took 2 days and was difficult
customer_reviews.text: Install was horrible. It took two days between work shifts and multiple trips to the hardware store. Please don't call this "EZ" Install. We ended up using a separately purchased valve adapter and compression nut & insert (pictured) that we brought separately. My home is 20 years old. I would expect a "EZ" install kit to include a few different sized adapters rather than just one size fits all. It clearly does not. As for the filtration, it is good to handle flavor issues related to chlorine usage and calcium usage in my area. It also looks nicer on the sink than one that you mount to the faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good filter system.
customer_reviews.text: Not very hard to install. Easy to install and replace the filter. For the install, I had to make a trip to Home Depot for some adapters since the plastic 3 way wasn't the size I needed. I also did not use the plastic 3 way that came with this. I recommend replacing that with a metal one since most of us have existing metal nuts below the sink. Screwing a metal nut to a plastic 3 way has a high chance of stripping the plastic ...leading to leaks down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Entreri

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect...
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to install. But...I have a higher end restaurant style faucet with sprayer end water outlet. The unit comes with connections for only old-style two 1/2 type inlets. Had to go to the big box hardware store and spend about $20 for new fittings to fit it to wall nipples. Otherwise, OK. So this ended up costing me $20 more than the original listing. Other systems use the almost industry standard wall nipple fittings and hardware. If you have two lines going up to two separate 1/2 fittings, you're going to be fine... Water is perfect...and coffee is coffeeier...
customer_reviews.author: GregG

customer_reviews.title: You Need a Plumber to Install
customer_reviews.text: Installation isn't as easy as they suggest. First off, most installations are going to require a trip to your local hardware store for different size fittings. Not many current faucets are going to work with the parts that are supplied with this setup. The installation now takes three times what it should and multiple parts are required with a good chance of leaking. I would not recommend this to anyone unless you're a plumber or are very good at reworking your plumbing. Culligan could have easily included a second fitting for those of us that have the smaller size fixtures. This seriously took the fun out of the purchase and I would look at another option next time.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: The battery goes in base of the spigot.
customer_reviews.text: No where in the instructions does it mention the "battery" (also could not find it on their web site). Installment under the sink was easy. We used the "soap dispenser" hole in the sink top, so that added to our ease. It took about an hour from start to finish. Our water tastes soooooo much better now. Don't forget to Teflon tape your attachments.
customer_reviews.author: The miller's

customer_reviews.title: Dramatic difference in water flavor. Some functional quirks.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: An incredible improvement in water taste. My municipal supply tastes like swimming pool. This fixed it. The filter is easy to change. Cons: The knob is stiff to grasp and turn, especially for old arthritic hands. The filter change reminder light blinks for a full month non-stop BEFORE you actually need to change. I believe this is why Culligan stopped supplying the battery for the warning light unit. I called them, and they are now recommending using a reminded sticker instead, and leaving the battery out,
customer_reviews.author: Fleetside Garage

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!  Make sure you...
customer_reviews.text: After installing, if your not getting water, make sure your filter is completely in the lock position (turning filter clockwise into housing until you hear extra click or arrows are aligned) which allows the water to flow freely throughout the connected 1/4" tubing and filter. I ended up uninstalling and then reinstalling to troubleshoot until i realized the cartridge was not completely secured. It comes with a 1/2" T-adapter to connect to your existing under the sink water line\shut off valve but I needed a 3/8"x3/8"x1/4" T-adapter which I purchased with a separate shut-off valve to the 1/4" quick connect tubing found here  Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Bushey

customer_reviews.title: Terrible taste
customer_reviews.text: This filter removes the chlorine but leaves a "medicine-like" taste. It is barely drinkable but makes terrible coffee and tea. The filter assembly was easy to install and seemed to be great for the first few days. Then a leak was discovered where the filter cartridge inserts into the housing. It appeared to be the o'rings not sealing properly. Called Culligan tech support who was very helpful and courteous. They sent a replacement cartridge and head assembly the next day. The new filter cartridge was installed, and that corrected the leak. The taste however, is still unacceptable. If I can't find a suitable filter cartridge that removes most of the taste, I will remove the entire assembly.
customer_reviews.author: J.C., retired

customer_reviews.title: Horrible (Culligan , I hope you read this!)
customer_reviews.text: The flow is quite slow even though I gave no problems with pressure at the sink. I expect this is not a defect but simply the style of the filter. The output takes FORever to fill a pot, so i do not recommend for the kitchen. Also, it came with a defective filter and Culligan would not replace free. Their tech support/customer service is AWFUL. I called towards the end of their shift (apparently) because the man who answered listened to me explain the issue then said; " I know just the guy to help you," cold transferred me to a VM that said the help desk was closed for the day!! ARGH!!!! I returned it that day.
customer_reviews.author: Yrofthetiger

customer_reviews.title: Adequate but cant fix everything.
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this for one year. When we installed it, we had just bought the house and repaired the water softener. Our water tastes like rubber boots. While it made a valiant attempt, though it tasted better, it was still booty water. As time went by things got better and I'm happy to say that a year later this filter is able to combat the now nickle flavored water. Our family of 7 drinks water happily from this tap everyday. It was worth every penny and all effort invested and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska mindy Rain

customer_reviews.title: The new adaptor leaked just like the first one
customer_reviews.text: Instalation is simple except for the nylon adaptor. I removed the sprayer hose and installed the faucet in the existing hole. After making all connections I turned on the water supply. It leaked... Went over the connections, still leaked. After checking everything it was obvious it was the nylon adaptor. A small defect causing it to leak from the body of the adaptor. Requested a replacement. The new adaptor leaked just like the first one. Could not find one in Home Depot or Lowes. Called Culligan, no help. Finally had to cut the copper and install compression fittings. Whtat a pain in the neck. Works fine now but this could have all been avoided if the adaptor was not plastic!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Z.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy and works great.
customer_reviews.text: So far it's been installed for about 3 months without issue. The flow rate is really good and the water is clear and clean. The only complaint I had is my sink supply lines are 5/8" and the kit does not offer any way to adapt it. I know my faucet is not standard so it took multiple hardware store trips to find a suitable adapter for the quick connect but eventually I made it work. I'm only giving 4 stars since they only provide one size of adapter to make it work, wish there were a couple options but other than that minor detail, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: TheDudeMan

customer_reviews.title: Good under sink filter.
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a Britta filter pitcher. The install took 20 minutes and was exactly as the instructions said. Easy, and Quick. The water tastes great and the sink faucet is a real convenience. We are currently using the middle of the road filter as this is a step up for us from a Britta pitcher filter, but the same housing will accept the Premium / Advanced filter cartridge. FYI I had to order a different faucet as the chrome finish one that was supplied did not match our oil rubbed bronze kitchen faucet. Still worth the money and time to install.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer ALD

customer_reviews.title: Kudos to Culligan!
customer_reviews.text: Installation went well after I purchased a $3.89 adapter to co connect the water line to both faucet and water filter. Also used a flex hose in the process. Took me about 2 hours to install system/ and 1.5 hours of shopplng at Home Depot to complete task I'm fairly experienced with installing faucets after 33 years of home ownership. A novice might need some tech advice. The you-tube instructional is very helpful. The water is excellent quality with the premium filter, our coffee has improved dramatically. Kudos to Culligan for a fine product!
customer_reviews.author: jscantone

customer_reviews.title: The filter casing can fail catastrophically and without warning
customer_reviews.text: Good thing we were home to hear the sound of water spraying into our under sink cabinet. The plastic cap on the bottom of the filter cartridge (RC-EZ-1) split open and began to spray water. We had the tap installed for 18 months and this was the replacement filter which was installed about 8 months ago. Looks like a straightforward pressure caused structural failure which means there’s something wrong with the design of this type of cartridge. Luckily it’s as easy to uninstall the whole unit as it was to install it!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Bendt

customer_reviews.title: OK, once it's installed
customer_reviews.text: Nice filter, but installation was less than optimal. First of all, there is no flange for the bottom of the faucet. So if you're installing in an existing sink hole, like I did, you have to manufacture your own bottom flange because the little nylon nut will not cut it. I ended up finding an old rubber furniture foot pad in the basement, and drilling out a hole. What a pain. Secondly, the in-line water adapter is not common household size. I finally used a brass t-fitting I had, and a copper tubing compression fitting. If it weren't for my bountiful basement, the installation would have been very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Shocking result, terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: After I set up the filter, ran about 10 min with tab water (city water) and then tested the water quality and the result is shockingly terrible which is 308 ppm!!!! Normally the water quality for drinking water under 50 ppm and 51 to 100 is kind of tolerable but it is 308 ppm and not drinkable AT ALL Manufacture of this product, please explain about this, I feel I am defrauded after I saw the result. Please tell us why it is so terrible quality
customer_reviews.author: Ray Roh

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to the Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This water dispenser and filter were really easy to install. We already had a space in our sink for it so there was no cutting needed, only had to remove our old soap dispenser. The water tastes perfectly fine, I am not expecting “magic” from this very affordable water filter system. I would recommend this to any basic DIYer looking for a quick solution for a water dispenser in there sink.
customer_reviews.author: AQucsaiJr

customer_reviews.title: Good system, easy installation, buy your own adapter fittings, etc.
customer_reviews.text: Good system, and easy to install. The only problem is the adapter tee. It is 1/2 inch and not trustworthy as said by other reviewers. I needed 3/8, so I got an adapt a tee 3/8x3/8 1/4 inch brass fitting. I used a 1/4 tube insert with 1/4 inch brass compression nut. And, minuscule amount of teflon tape. Works great, no leaks and no surprises. Dont take a chance. The hardware I bought cost $8.76 at the local hardware store. Do it this way and you won't have a bad cast tastrophy ( pun) by not using the included add a line tee. Its nylon and some suffer pinhole failures. Besides, it may not fit anyway. Mine didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Telling it like it is.

customer_reviews.title: This is sooo much better than a faucet mount filter
customer_reviews.text: This is sooo much better than a faucet mount filter. I'm married to a plumber so had no trouble getting it installed. My only complaint is that if you have arthritic hands then you may want to order a model that has a better on/off handle. The current handle is bulky and oddly shaped. Water flows fast and clean. We did opt to purchase an extra EZ-Connect Adapter to allow a second water supply but this was personal preference and by no means related to the quality of the filter unit. Recommended; YES Would I purchase again: Yes, but a model with a different easy on/off handle.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Hey Culligan Man!!  Quality matters!!!
customer_reviews.text: I knew from other reviews that I should expect cheap plastic on the faucet. I don’t know how many other buyers had a supply line that was ready for the adaptor, but even my hardware store didn’t carry a supply valve with 1/2” NPS 14. I was able to order the needed 3/8” adapter thanks to another reviewer. The reason for 1 star? Drilled my 1/8” pilot. Third turn of my screwdriver and the head twisted right off the screw. Come on, Culligan!!! Charge 38 cents more and provide high quality materials!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Although the size of the connections wasn’t the same of what I already had it only took one trip to the hardware store to get the right coupler. After installing it it wouldn’t work, I emailed Culligan customer service and received troubleshooting within 1 business day. It was user error 🙃 I hadn’t Locked the filter into the full locked position. But now it’s working and the water tastes great. Super convenient .
customer_reviews.author: cym

customer_reviews.title: Why does Culligan supply 1/2” fitting?
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I had to go to Home Depot 3 times and I actually was referred to go to a plumbing supply store, George Morlan plumping supply. I was in and out of the supply store in five minutes and I got the job done for $6.80 because Culligan part is 1/2 instead of 3/8, why did they do this if universal fit for kitchen sink is 3/8
customer_reviews.author: Enteng

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with it now
customer_reviews.text: I would give this five stars if it came with a 3/8" adapter as well. My house isn't that old and the cold water outlet is 3/8". This adapter DID NOT work. It is 1/2", but unless I missed that, I didn't see it in the description. I ended up purchasing this for $12 more:  That made this a $50 purchase, which is more than I wanted to spend. I am very happy with it now, (other than the total of $50). It appears to me that it will last much longer than the typical faucet attaching system. I simply drilled a hole in the back of my sink to add it.
customer_reviews.author: Wrango

customer_reviews.title: Included adapter is trash
customer_reviews.text: I dislike that I have to spend more money to buy an actual adapter that will work instead of this plastic piece of garbage that has done nothing but cause tears and a major waste of my time. I may update when I get to use the filter, but as for installation, it’s come to a wet screeching halt as there seems to be no way to attach this plastic POS without cross threading.
customer_reviews.author: Someone's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase be prepared for a trip to the hardware store
customer_reviews.text: The install is not difficult but was not as easy as the video made it seem. I had to drill an additional hole in my sink and the kit only comes with a 1/2” adapter. Considering how common 3/8” supply line is and how inexpensive a pvc adapter is they should have just included it. The water taste is great, next time I will probably go with the more expensive ez-5 filter just to see if it’s worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Micah T Fogleman

customer_reviews.title: 20 minutes to install and it works great
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in an RV so we could worry that much less the water quality where we stay.... We use a filter coming into to the RV fresh water system and sanitize the system at the beginning of each season, but you never know about the water spigot at each park...... The installation was fast and easy, the hardest part was deciding where to drill the hole to mount it. The thing I'd change is putting a small accumulator/reservoir just after the filter as it's a little slow my liking..... that'll be a future upgrade for us for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and easy to install water filter system.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and easy to install water filter system. The water tastes great! The water spout that is included is very nice and the valve is easy to grasp and turn. The included step by step instructions are easy to read and follow. The installation of the filter into the filter mount is very simple, just make sure you line up the marks. There is a lock and unlock mark.
customer_reviews.author: harleyrrt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent filter system
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how well this works. I have well water that contains alot of rust etc, and this system cleans everything out. I'm extremely happy with this purchase. Still waiting to see how long the filters actually last, but I don't care if I have to buy a new filter every 60 days. It's still cheaper and more eco friendly than bottled water. BTW, I installed it by myself in just about 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Defective and cheap parts...just purchase a better unit and spend some extra money.
customer_reviews.text: I got everything installed after several trips to get an adapter to use for my setup instead of the included plastic fitting. I ended up buying an metal adapter on Amazon which was perfect, though cost me another $15. After everything was installed I discovered the faucet was defective. Since I threw away the box I’ll need to buy a new faucet. It ended up being quite expensive after piecing together parts that will work.
customer_reviews.author: C-Waldo

customer_reviews.title: Good instructions and small amount of parts made it look ...
customer_reviews.text: I received the Culligan a day early and got right to the installation. Good instructions and small amount of parts made it look easy. With one exception, it was. It's easy to mount the filter and lines. Locating a good spot and mounting the faucet, making line connections were all easy with shark type connections. My only problem was with my existing water line. I have 1/2 in. lines and a 3/8 in. Male fitting above my cold water shutoff. A quick trip to Home Depot yielded the brass parts in the picture below. Once connected, there was no leaks and I'm getting great tasting water!
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality.
customer_reviews.text: OK, it works but it's full of problems. 1. the nob to turn it on is very tight and hard to grip. Making if extremely hard to turn on and off. I had to wrap a rubber band around it to be able to grip it to turn it easily. 2. The flow rate is extremely slow. I've got bad water pressure as it is, this made things worse. 3. The spout is very flimsy. I feel if it gets hit even slightly by accident, it will break. Or turned too hard. Overall, I should have shopped around more to get a better unit.
customer_reviews.author: Narg

customer_reviews.title: I Upgraded Some Parts
customer_reviews.text: The filter is excellent but I replaced the plastic Culligan faucet (with Aquaboon Brushed Nickel Water Filter Faucet) and adapter valve valve (with JG Speedfit ASVP1LF 3/8) based on other reviews regarding leaks and faucet break downs. So essentially I did not use most of the system but once installed with sturdy parts I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Suffern

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the basic filter so I already knew what to expect for the size. I read some of the previous reviews, someone said to use a different stop Tee " JG Speedfit ASVPP1LF " This tee has a metal body and a nylon part that the hose fits into. It also has the ability to shut off the water to the filter. The install itself went well except for almost not having the clearance when bolting down the filter top. As for the water, it tastes like nothing, exactly how its suppose to taste.
customer_reviews.author: marcuslester

customer_reviews.title: Safe water
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a faucet attached water filter and although it worked fine it was bulky and ugly. This water filter was the perfect solution. It was easy to install but the adapter included was the wrong size. Home Depot and local hardware stores did not have any adapters that would work with both my sink and the water filter. I ended up going to a water filter supply store. They had the correct size for less than $10.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Recommended by me
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy to install and works great. Check your valve size, the "T" connector that come with it is 3/4" mine are 5/8". Went to Lowes and bought a brass 5/8" adapter that fit. Just a few bucks. Product was delivered on time by Prime, and in good packaging. The filter choices need to be looked at. Although the filter that comes with it last for 3,000 gallons and only costs $10.00 to replace. The better filters #2 or #3 do not last as long, but they filter many more things and are worth the additional cost.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Folen

customer_reviews.title: Awful Awful Awful
customer_reviews.text: Lack of 3/8" adapter is a major fail. Unsuccessfully spent an hour at Home Depot working with an associate there to try to find something that could work with our existing 3/8" supply valve. Also, faucet handle does not appear to have been designed for human hands. It's bizzare. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Le Fish

customer_reviews.title: Okay filter system with a cheap faucet.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice filter system, especially how I'm using it in a shop sink. It's good to have filtered drinking water handy. I had to replace the faucet with a better quality one, after 6 months of light use. The filter and hoses are still doing fine and provide better tasting drinking water than the tap water here in North Kohala district of Hawaii island. Bottom line, okay filter system with a cheap faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: The water tastes great, the faucet is a little flimsy but ok. The installation was quite difficult. It involved drilling through cast iron sink, so depending on the material of your sink it might be easier. Then the connection for the water line under the sink needed an adapter because it wouldn't fit (about $20 in Home depot). The water tastes, looks great, no smells. We live in an area with increased risk for lead water so happy to have this filter. Initially we bought the Wooder but since it doesn't come with a dedicated faucet it wastes a lot of filtered water so we got this instead and the water tastes a even better.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great little water fountain for the money. Our contractor installed it so cannot vouch for how easy that was but there was no yelling , cussing or throwing of hammers so I’ll assume it’s standard. One star off because the tap to turn it on and off feels a little flimsy and to my senses , seems to turn backwards. Water tastes just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Buysstuff

customer_reviews.title: no leaks
customer_reviews.text: after installing a different filter system which leaked and was difficult to change, I thought I was going to have to go back to the pitcher filter method. then I saw this product. simple to install. effortless filter change-out. what a difference. and NO LEAKS. ZERO. this is the choice if you're looking for an alternative to the pitcher method. I cannot give a higher recommendation. thinking about adding one to the fridge. really the best out there.
customer_reviews.author: tonycer

customer_reviews.title: Just What You Need.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my 12 year old culligan Rep. installed faucet with this one, hooked right up. Could not locate or they would not sell me a new cartridge, was leaking after 12 years. This worked out better than having them do it and you know the rest of the story.
customer_reviews.author: Lone Wulf

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to buy pipe adapters
customer_reviews.text: Everything went smoothly except that my pipes were a smaller size than the 3 way adapter they provide so I had to go to Home Depot for pipe reducers which I never found. Ended up just buying a new 3 way piece that fits my pipes and a 1/4 inch tube compression adapter to fit the supply line to the filter. I'm happy with the end result but man, HD 3 times to figure it out since pipes come in either inside diameter or outside diameter which boned me a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Expert buyer

customer_reviews.title: Decent filter,  missing critical parts and wrong adapter.
customer_reviews.text: Well as a water filter time will tell, as a kit and product seller this is pretty sh***. Came with a 3/4 inch adapter, not a 1/2 like the manual states, no big deal, but the part that pisses me off is it didn't come with the ferrule or compression nut to attach the tubing to the sang faucet. What the hell is that?!? Why sell a lot if you don't include all the parts needed to install it. Damn BS
customer_reviews.author: 404UserNotFound

customer_reviews.title: does not work!
customer_reviews.text: Plumber installed for me. Does not work (no water comes through.) Plumber advised that filters are sometimess clogged at factory, and to replace it. Did. Still did not work. Returning for refund which will help offset the plumber's bill.
customer_reviews.author: Raccoon

customer_reviews.title: Good filter, but annoying install if you don't have 1/2" threads
customer_reviews.text: We've been using the filter for a few years now and it has held up well and the water tastes good. However, it comes with tubing that connects to a provided tee which assumes 1/2" threads are available on the cold water pipe of the faucet. My old faucet had 1/2" thread, but I got a new sink which only has 3/8 compression fittings. Seems hard to find an appropriate adapter, and given that so many under-sink connections are 3/8 compression, this should have been provided.
customer_reviews.author: David Kuehlewind

customer_reviews.title: No difference in taste
customer_reviews.text: Install time 2hr im slow, taking it off 45mins, Water tasted the same no difference in taste quality tds results are the same as my tap water without a filter , i called customer service left a message with my info it took them 3 days to reply back i ended up returning the product
customer_reviews.author: AROD

customer_reviews.title: Good basic filter
customer_reviews.text: OK, I'll start by saying that any time you're installing something under the sink it's not the easiest job. Still, the installation is pretty straightforward. The kit only includes one adapter fitting, so if you're dealing with something other than 1/2 inch NPT you'll need to make a trip to the hardware store. The push-in fittings aren't leaking, and the water tastes pretty good, so overall I'm fairly pleased with this filter, especially when you factor in the price.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap filtered water system.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to stop buying water bottles and to get rid of a brita pitcher. Installation was a breeze with the included hardware. I didn't need to buy anything additional. After installing, we were able to get cold, clean water on demand! We have very clean tap water, and the single filter was more than enough for what we needed. The only issue we have that prevents it from getting 5 stars is that the faucet pipe that comes out of the handle is low quality. It does not seal tightly and can drip water if rotated. I can also see it getting bent in the future if someone hits it with a pot or pan while washing dishes.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Works well and will work even better in the future.
customer_reviews.text: Easily installed and working fine. My next move is to buy the EZ #4 filter to remove more contaminants in the water. The price make it possible to start using the filter easily. The one thing it can't remove is the fluoride. For that a reverse osmosis system would be needed at a much higher cost. For now it is perfect. BTW...a comparison taste test of my water proved it removed the chlorine taste immediately. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: RCA

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Very pleased with the water.
customer_reviews.text: Great water. Good pressure. Straightforward to install although I did go to YouTube to watch some installation videos. As others mentioned, I used plumbers tape on the male fittings and did not over tighten the plastic fittings. I’ve had it for a week or so now and am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: NH Reader

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install - Water has no taste now. Good.
customer_reviews.text: Hey, the water is suppose to not have any taste? Our municipal water is fine and the water reports are well below "acceptable levels". The thing is, in the Spring and Fall the lake turns over due to the drastic temperature change and our water tastes and smells like the lake for a couple of weeks a year. This filter took the lake out of our pasta, coffee, boiled eggs, everything. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Handygal

customer_reviews.title: It Works and is Priced Right
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I had a competitor’s filter system for over 10 years and it was time for a replacement. Culligan is wonderful especially since you can select from three different cartridges based on your level of filtration needs and budget. My picky complaint is being able to install the battery. The little slot was hard to open and reinsert — at least for me.
customer_reviews.author: Billy J.

customer_reviews.title: Geat filter for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I installed the filter at my moms house and she loved it. The installation was super easy. The only thing I am disappointed with is the life of the filter. My mom lives alone and the filtered water is on it's own faucet so only gets used once or twice a day. After 10 months, the filter cartridge blocked and water started leaking under the sink. Needles to say, my mom woke up to a mess the next morning. I do not want to give a negative review, even though at the time she was very upset, because we are very satisfied with this system and I understand things do not always work as they should.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Torres

customer_reviews.title: Decent, that's about it.....
customer_reviews.text: The reviews are telling the truth. Just buy a new T fitting (with valve) prior cause what they send is worthless and cheap. I think my PUR faucet filter taster better but this flows nicely and should be sufficient. I will probably upgrade this once the filter is done but I will use it for now.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a TDS meter to test the water out of this filter. It took my 447ppm tap water down to 440!..that's it. Disappointed Af. I bought this to replace my Britta ultra max which is getting the water down to 333ppm. This is crap. Now I have waisted money I should have put towards a reverse osmosis system. Also my granite counter top was too thick! I had to buy a diamond bit and ghetto grind it out so it would all screw together.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, easy to install, requires adapters.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a good price, installed easily, but the plastic t-connector required an adapter on the input to increase the size, then an adapter on the output to adapt back down. It would have been nice it they would have included a second t-connector for the smaller pipe fittings that are on many sinks. I had to go out and spend $12 on adapters.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: The connector that came with it is too big for my currently pipe. I had to buy an extra adapter from Homedepot just to connect this. My suggestion is to have an adapter that have a standanrd 3/8 adapter so that we could just add it to an existing water adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Joy

customer_reviews.title: Used it as additional filter for my fridge
customer_reviews.text: My new place is an old house with old pipes (built in 1950). The refrigerator's filter didn't work too well, the water tastes like it's got some chemicals in it. So I had to look for additional filtering before getting the water to the fridge. This filter has the exact same tubes used by the fridge as well, saved me a whole lot of trouble! Finally the water from the fridge tastes great! Notes: Super easy installation, just kinda annoying to let the water run for 10 mins first when new filter is used (to get rid of fine carbons etc.) The screws given aren't meant to be installed on dry walls, I used my own sharky and screws instead.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C.

customer_reviews.title: midrange price wise, convenient change out, high filter level
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th one, easy install, high level 4 stack of filter materials, nothing wrong with construction, very durable 1/4' wall pvc pipe, it won't break or leak. (it's hidden away anyway) I did a lot of research, these are not the absolute cheapest, in the mid range, but worth it, based on high filter function, and capacity. Nothing is 100 percent filtering, but these are close to it. II don't get crazy about calculating when to replace, just quick, easy, change out, about once every 8+ months, I drink a lot of tea.
customer_reviews.author: southeastflorida

customer_reviews.title: Great Tasting Water & a Good Looking Filter
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, LOVE the end result. Our water tastes great and we rest assured that a lot more bad stuff is being filtered out. Installation is pretty strait forward (instructions are not the best but there are several videos on youtube) but with one exception; I found the plastic "T" used to splice the water line to the filter to be very flimsy. During installation, I cracked it far easier than I thought possible. However, this piece can be replaced for a few bucks at the local hardware store with brass hardware for a few bucks. Also, make sure to use plumbers tape on everything.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Replaced RO with this unit.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced our 10 yr old reverse osmosis, good water ac-30, with this unit. AC-30 system had a bad oder and taste that was noticeable after about 2 months of filter replacement, even after disinfecting with bleach per manufacture directions. Filter kits for the RO were way to expensive to burning through, also RO wastes to much water, so away with that system and back to simplicity. 20-30 minute install was straight forward and no leaking anywhere. I see that I can purchase any of the EZ filter line and they will all work with this head unit. I will try one of the better filters once this one is beyond it's useful life.
customer_reviews.author: PublicName

customer_reviews.title: My water definitely tastes better.  And by "water", I mean "coffee".
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't know how well this thing is working, with the exception of the fact that water from the tap tastes like crap. Water through this doesn't taste that bad. I'm pretty handy, so installation was quick. I didn't use the plastic "T" that came with thins.. instead, I had bought a valve with the 3/8" compression for the tap, and a 1/4" compression to go to the filter. Water flows quickly, and the faucet, while kind of chincy, is holding up well after a week of use. When it comes time to replace the filter, I think we're going to go with a #3.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny B

customer_reviews.title: While the filter itself isn't too bad to install and it looks nice
customer_reviews.text: While the filter itself isn't too bad to install and it looks nice, you may have to buy several extra adapters to hook this up. This came with an adapter that wouldn't work, and we did have to spend some money finding one that would actually connect to our water supply. So it may not be quite as simple as it looks.
customer_reviews.author: CLBoff

customer_reviews.title: So Simple to get clean drinkable water...
customer_reviews.text: We had a new counter top installed in our kitchen. We wanted to install an under the counter water filter tat was reliable. This was the answer. It is performing as intended. It also was installed with ease. Thank you, Culligan.
customer_reviews.author: Jim McConnell

customer_reviews.title: Pretty easy to install, no more stinky chlorine
customer_reviews.text: Our home has municipal water source that makes everything smell of clorine. I installed this myself with very little fuss and cursing. The hardest part was finding the right placement so I could get to the filter relatively easy. I can now fill up a glass of water and take a drink without smelling chlorine. That's all I really want.
customer_reviews.author: heather dollman

customer_reviews.title: Easy install - Great Filtration
customer_reviews.text: Simple to install, it comes with everything you should need for most sink plumbing setups. The filtration is top of the line (having owned many types and brands over the years). The water taste is perfect, and surprisingly better than bottled water. Although it was not our original plan, we stopped buying bottled water completely, making this also a money saver.
customer_reviews.author: M. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Water damage from a bad part.
customer_reviews.text: When I installed all the filtration system, by their instructions, I noticed the rubber/plastic grommet was misshapen. However, they are suppose to conform when pressure from the nut is applied. It didn’t. It didn’t leak for the 2 min I was under the sink checking while the system was running and shut off. Cabinets need replaced now. “Thanks Culligan man!”
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BUY A BETTER UNIT.  POOR MANUFACTURING !
customer_reviews.text: JUNK ! Proprietary tee fitting was faulty. Had a pinhole leak. This makes it a ONE STAR Rating. Cost me half the cost of the unit to create a fitting to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: P N

customer_reviews.title: It was a hit
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this Culligan US-EZ-1 EZ-Change Undersink Drinking Water Filtration System with Dedicated Faucet over a year ago, mu husband installed it and it's been working great every since. we have a lot of hard water where we live so it has made a big differences in the taste and on our coffee pot
customer_reviews.author: Penny Ott

customer_reviews.title: Filter is great, Faucet bottom stem is shorter
customer_reviews.text: Filter is great, Faucet bottom stem is shorter , which is preventing from connecting the tube coming from faucet. If you are going to mount on a kitchen granite counter top this will not work. Spoke to Brad at Culligan Technical support he said they don't have any solution for this. What I did was to remove the battery portion of the faucet and fix it ,and seal it with flexseal to prevent water seepage.
customer_reviews.author: Bala

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to run to hardware store
customer_reviews.text: After a trip to the hardware store for parts this unit works great. But be prepared to make a parts run if your connection is not 1/2". That is what is supplied and mine and I'm sure many others are 3/8" connections. Had to go to a big box hardware store and buy a 3/8" tee for $8 to get my unit connected. Also they tell you to use Teflon tape on faucet end and they do not supply that either. You would think Culligan would supply you with a one cent piece of Teflon tape but not. Water taste is is dramatically improved and unit has very good water flow as well .
customer_reviews.author: bradley d bieler

customer_reviews.title: fairly easy to install unit
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat, fairly easy to install unit. Amazon was quick to replace a missing part (I may have lost it), at no charge. However, it doesn't seem to clean the water nearly as well as my Pur pitcher filter. My tea doesn't look as crystal clear and leaves a residue in my glass after brewing. I suspect this is a more porous filter than the Pur filter. It will likely last much longer, but not filter as well as the Pur. I beleive Culligan offers better filters for this device, but those probably won't last as long either. That's always the trade off with filtration + better filtration = less life as the filter clogs more quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K. Close

customer_reviews.title: Culligan Filter
customer_reviews.text: I live in the country and have very hard water, I have to use a whole house filter then it goes into the softener then into the house but it still is somewhat hard! Put this in the sprayer hole in the sink and so far it seems to work for my coffee water but may need the stronger filter? All I use it for is my coffee water.
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install, but pay attention if you have a soft water system.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is pretty easy to hook up. Likely, ultra easy to hook up if you follow the instructions. However, most people will have soft water systems installed in their home, and tapping off the cold faucet at the sink runs softened water through the filter. Not ideal for quality and pretty much the exact opposite I wanted. So, with a simple saddle valve kit purchased separately to tap into the unconditioned water line, I have good tasting water for the family to drink and cook with. I especially enjoy the idea of upgrading filters if needed without having to change anything else. Overall a nice kit but I don't recommend installation as described in the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Denise D.

customer_reviews.title: Oxidation
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in February- now in May the end of the faucet is showing oxidation and the silver plating is coming off revealing plastic underneath. Took me a week of going back and forth to the hardware store to fix the leaky connector to the cold water line. In the end copious amounts of plumbers tape was used in the threads. I was very happy with this after the some what nightmare installation (kept having to take apart the sink to check the leak on the cold water line) but the oxidation of the plastic coated parts is not good. I’m trying to keep toxins out of my water- not add more in
customer_reviews.author: lweber

customer_reviews.title: Clean water on demand
customer_reviews.text: Best filter ever. No problems with it. Just waiting to see how long it last before I purchase a replacement. The filter is suppose to last around 6 months, however, everyone's usage is different. Once you know your useage you can get replacement sent thru auto-ship and you save money. After almost a year - It works fine. No leaks no worries. Unfortunately for me auto-ship doesn't allow you to really select when you really need a new filter. The longest span is 6 months. I can actually go more to 7 months. That extra month makes a difference to me, but not enough of a difference with regards to by opinion of the product. Still loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Ropes

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for anyone that is iffy about their tap water.
customer_reviews.text: This filter was very easy to install under my sink, even with my limited plumbing experience. I had to go to Lowe's to get a few adapters for my specific setup, but after a little problem solving this was easily done and everything went together nicely. I personally think the water from the filter tastes great, and it has saved me a fortune not having to buy gallons of water, which were costing me about a dollar a day. Now, I'm spending pennies to the gallon and the filter is so easy to change every 3-6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S.

customer_reviews.title: Great filter system, easy install!
customer_reviews.text: Love this filter...both times I purchased it. Both times was super easy install, only requires your to be able to read and follow directions. if you dont already have a spot on your sink, you will have to drill, but if you already have this type of device on your sink, you can use the existing hole. the filter is wonderful, tastes great. As with all new filters, you need to let it run a bit to flush the filter a bit. youll notice the water is white, but it goes away after a bit. I just let mine run for a few minutes at a time. Repeat 5 or 6 times and itll be good..
customer_reviews.author: Chris Todd

customer_reviews.title: Requires extra parts in order not to leak
customer_reviews.text: The unit itself is fine. Tastes great. The issue is the cheap parts it comes with leak unless your install is perfect. I had to go to Home Depot and pick up decent fittings. Unfortunately they ship with terrible parts. I can’t return part to amazon either so I’m left out of pocket. I recommend the main filter but don’t use any of the fittings this comes with. Culligan - please note.
customer_reviews.author: Dan G

customer_reviews.title: Culligan Undersink US EZ-4 Water Filter
customer_reviews.text: Got this smaller version of an under sink water filter and I am very pleased with the outcome. Had to have patience because I tried to go to the Brick and M stores to get an adapter with a shut-off valve at the cold water connection, but returned to Amazon to order what I needed. After the finished installation with a little silicone faucet grease, and I made a fresh pot of coffee, all is good! "I liiike it"
customer_reviews.author: J. Herman

customer_reviews.title: Savings
customer_reviews.text: Nice ... the one in my house came with the house and to replace filters is $60.00 a filter so do the math and you’ll see the saving plus easy to install that’s what my son said .... so save...
customer_reviews.author: David M. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and works very well...
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were easy to follow and were a big help. Connections are very sturdy and well made...if you plan on mounting the unit under the sink but not too close to the water supply, you may need longer hoses. Just remember "measure twice, cut once". The difference in taste was not noticeable, but my K-Cup coffee comes out oh-so good now that I'm using filtered water.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Perez

customer_reviews.title: Under sink
customer_reviews.text: The adapter was way to big for this old house. Not going to get pipes ripped out to accommodate. Had to make modifications in basement and reading all reviews I think better if it’s gonna leak it does it in the wash room. So far so good. Update!!! I tested the water and it’s not a very good filter that’s for sure’
customer_reviews.author: Mar63

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install, great tasting water.
customer_reviews.text: This was such a joy to install. The instructions are clear as day and make installing a breeze. I mounted this near my garbage disposal and it came with enough tubing to reach across to the main pipe. I was worried that I would have to buy another fitting, but the one supplied was perfect. I am very pleased and looking to install this in other sinks in my house. The thing I like the most is that my water is now so tasty, and my coffee is so much better. My wife tested the PH levels and it was at 7.1 tested a few weeks later and it was at 7.0.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: L
customer_reviews.text: Amazing filter, no chlorine taste. I tried a glass of plain tap water after the filtered water....gross. We only drink and cook with filtered water now, no going back.
customer_reviews.author: 25 Bravo

customer_reviews.title: Unlimited clean drinking water
customer_reviews.text: This kit is awesome. Easy to install with a few tools and about 30 mins of spare time. This filtration system replaced my faucet mounted pUR filter. I drink about 3 gallons of water per day and that pUR faucet system was not cutting it. Its been almost 3 month of use and no leaking or problem. I also use this filtered water to fill my counter top ice maker.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Best on the Market
customer_reviews.text: The water quality is superb and matches or exceeds bottled water. Culligan has great instructions and all required parts for installation. The only negative (and why I gave it a four star) is that the faucet is on the cheap side and only comes in chrome. I never bothered trying to install it and replaced it with a better brush nickel faucet. Installation was a pain but that was only because I needed to replace my corroded sink water supply faucets. Remember, you will need to turn off the water to the filter to change the filter cartridge once or twice a year so the cold water supply needs to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Short Field

customer_reviews.title: Missing Ferrule (part B)- fixed
customer_reviews.text: Came with a 3/4 inch adapter, not a 1/2 like the manual states But most critical Ferrule (part B) missing (of pic 6. connecting the faucet.) Please send me one ASAP! Upgraded to 4 stars , after Culligan support mailed me the missing parts It is a decent filter system
customer_reviews.author: MikeB

customer_reviews.title: Works well, good filtration options, looks nice
customer_reviews.text: The filter seems to work very well, and I like that you can use different filters with it depending on the level of filtration you want. It looks nice and isn't too difficult to install. The only small thing I think could be improved is that the spout, even though it's properly in place and tightened, wiggles a little bit from side to side. It doesn't leak or cause problems -- my preference would just be that it could pivot but not wiggle. I would really only deduct half a star for that, but there are no half-star ratings so I gave it four.
customer_reviews.author: L. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: and the water tastes just as good. However
customer_reviews.text: The Culligan US-EZ-3 leaves a lot of space under the sink, compared to our previous reverse osmosis system, and the water tastes just as good. However, it has such a ridiculously slow water fill rate that my son wants to put an aquarium pump on it to speed things up. We only use it for drinking water, so if you need to filter cooking water, forget about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Gordon

customer_reviews.title: No need to buy bottled water, bottle your own water for pennies.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and with the 500 gallon capacity, I don't have to change filters as often as the ones I had attached at the end of the faucet. Easy to change the cartridges too. There is a huge difference in taste and smell of the filtered water. The only thing I have a gripe about is to turn the water on and off is the opposite of what the "standard" is. Usually it's lefty loosey, righty tighty. Definitely not a deal breaker especially considering all the benefits of the filtered water as well as the capacity of the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Mike F.

customer_reviews.title: Save the bottles
customer_reviews.text: Installation is a breeze, IF you have all the parts. The parts sent have you turning off the house line to install, thus, if the line leaks or breaks you have to shut off the entire house. I went to Ace hardware and bought a T set up for the cold water faucet line. Now if I have an issue, I can just turn off the cold water under the sink. See pictures for reference. The parts cost me $11.69 thus the 4 star rating of have to go buy parts and increase over all cost.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Littlejohn

customer_reviews.title: Great filter, easy to install and change filters
customer_reviews.text: Great filter, easy to install and change filters. The filter lasts about 6 months. We found that city water really only needs a #2 filter for taste, however I like the filtration qualities of the #3. The unit will accept all filters, #2,3 and 4 depending on your water quality.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Catalano

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value and no more chlorine taste!
customer_reviews.text: Not too difficult to install, lasts a year so great value, and it tastes so clean as we're I live the water is very chlorinated in smell and taste and this takes all that away!
customer_reviews.author: kayla rigole

customer_reviews.title: Like some other reviewers
customer_reviews.text: I have had this item for a few months now. Like some other reviewers, the faucet developed a drip, that quickly became constant. I purchased a replacement faucet, Watts 116023 Standard Faucet, Chrome. It doesn't drip so far. I hope the problem has been solved, but I only recently installed it. the parts that came with the new faucet didn't work with the lines provided by the old faucet, but utilizing some of the parts that came with the culligan line (the insert and compression ring), it has worked out so far. I like the quality of water that has come out of the filter. Just the faucet is not good quality.
customer_reviews.author: B Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Noticeable improvement in taste but long-term durability issues hinder the rating
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this product for a few years and it has performed well. The problem is the unit developed a leak twice, one time from the area where the filter is screwed in and the other time from the faucet itself. Thankfully the leaks were not too horrible. If this company decides to use higher quality parts, this would easily be a 4/5 or 5/5 worthy product. The company did honor the warranty for the first leak but for the second leak I decided to just replace the faucet with a higher quality one (ASIN B0018N0WEC) because the one it comes with is a piece of crap. The Culligan filter and the new faucet make a fantastic pair!
customer_reviews.author: Nader

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install..not a handyman
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this so I wouldn't have to deal with a Brita filter anymore. I installed it yesterday and have had no problems. My sink hole was already cut, so that makes a HUGE difference. I probably wouldn't have done it myself without the hole already being there. Hook up was easy. I actually used velcro instead of drilling holes inside my cabinets. Filtered water tastes just like my Brita pitcher and has very good water pressure. No leaks and you can still have the water running on the normal faucet at the same time as this unit, with little change in pressure. Great purchase and much cheaper than your home depot variety. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Upton

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts...
customer_reviews.text: Missing parts... (the small parts packet was completely missing) Had to go try and find pieces at Lowe's to install it. Then it was leaking. We have it working now, but I'm still afraid of it springing a leak when we aren't home (as some others have said...
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Q

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: bought this to replace a plastic portable 1 gallon water pitcher, decided to take plastics out of my food and drink, this installed very easy under sink, filter provides good taste to water, same as my other 2 stage filter i was using. No leaks or any issues so far. They give enough hose to make it easy to find a good mounting location so you have easy filter changes. Their other filters also work with this setup if you need more filtering. I have good water pressure here so i also have good flow out of this filter. Very happy with this and its a great price for what you get. I know use a glass water pitcher.
customer_reviews.author: racecar
